Package core

Class HlaWorld.Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.HlaWorld.Factory
  • Enclosing interface:
    HlaWorld
    public static class HlaWorld.Factory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory used to create an instance of the HlaWorld.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

      • create

        public static HlaWorld create​(HlaSettings settings,
                              boolean manualEvokeMode,
                              HlaTimeStampFactory timeStampFactory)
        Creates a HlaWorld with the specified settings and timestamps. The parameter manualEvokeMode decides if the instance will run in manual or auto evoke mode.

        Auto evoke mode

        All notifications for this HlaWorld instance will be delivered in the same thread, a thread that is created by HlaWorld. The notifications will be delivered automatically , as fast as possible. No need to call any evoke methods.

        Manual evoke mode

        In this mode notifications will be delivered when one of the evoke methods are called. The notification is delivered in the same thread that makes the call to the notification method. Note that the HlaWorld will be updated asynchronously, without need for evoke. If HlaSettings has been overridden with a settings file, the supplied settings will not be used. A new settings object will be created using the settings specified in the file. Exceptions thrown in the user notification code will be posted to the ExceptionListener.
        Parameters:
        settings - settings for this HlaWorld.
        manualEvokeMode - if True, the created instance will be in manual evoke mode, otherwise auto.
        timeStampFactory - factory used to create timestamps. The default factory is used if null is supplied. The timestamp factory can also be used to set the HLA User Defined Tag.
        Returns:
        the HlaWorld instance
